question_text: 1. The number of different 5 digit numbers greater than 50000 that can be formed using the digits 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, such that the sum of their first and last digits should not be more than 8, is
solution: Case I  5 _ _ _ 0 Case II   5 _ _ _ 1 5  2 5  3 6  0 6  1 6  2 7  0 Case IX    7 _ _ _ 1 9×(8×8×8)  =  4608  but  50000  is  not  included, so total numbers 4608 – 1 = 4607

6. Let A(x, y, z) be a point in xy-plane, which is equidistant from three points (0, 3, 2), (2, 0, 3) and (0, 0, 1). Let B = (1, 4, –1) and C = (2, 0, –2). Then among the statements (S1) : ABC is an isosceles right angled triangle and (S2) : the area of ABC is 9 2 2 .
7. The relation R={(x, y) : x, y  z and x + y is even} is :

options.(1): reflexive and transitive but not symmetric
options.(2): reflexive and symmetric but not transitive
options.(4): symmetric and transitive but not reflexive

solution: R = {(x, y) : x, y  z and x + y is even} reflexive x + x = 2x even symmetric of x + y is even, then (y + x) is also even transitive of x + y is even & y + z is even then x + z is also even So, relation is an equivalence relation.

33. Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R Assertion A: A sound wave has higher speed in solids than gases. Reason  R:  Gases  have  higher  value  of  Bulk modulus than solids. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below explanation of A explanation of A

options.(1): Both A and R are true and R is the correct
options.(2): A is false but R is true
options.(3): Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct
options.(4): A is true but R is false.

solution: Solids  have  higher  value  of  bulk modulus  than gases.

solution: V rms = 3RT M V 2 rms = 3RT/M Hence  we  can  conclude  that  V is  directly 2 rms proportional to temperature y = m x Graph will be straight line

question_text: 49. Two iron solid discs of negligible thickness have radii R 1 and R 2 and moment of intertia I 1 and I 2, respectively. For R 2 = 2R 1, the ratio of I 1 and I 2 would be 1/x, where x = _______

50. A double slit interference experiment performed with  a  light  of  wavelength  600  nm  forms  an interference fringe pattern on a screen with 10th bright  fringe  having  its  centre  at  a  distance  of 10 mm from the central maximum. Distance of the centre  of  the  same  10th  bright  fringe  from  the central  maximum  when  the  source  of  light  is replaced by another source of wavelength 660 nm would be_____mm.
solution: In case of YDSE the distance of nth maxima from central maxima is given by Y = n  D d Here n , D & d are same So, y ×   2  2  2  1 1 y  y 660 nm y  10 mm 600 nm y 2 = 11 mm

question_text: 51. The incorrect decreasing order of atomic radii is :
solution: Correct order of atomic radii : Be < Mg > Al > Si

question_text: 52. Given below are two statements : Statement I : In the oxalic acid vs KMnO 4 (in the presence of dil H 2SO 4) titration the solution needs to be heated initially to 60°C, but no heating is required in Ferrous ammonium sulphate (FAS) vs KMnO 4 titration (in the presence of dil H 2SO 4) Statement II : In oxalic acid vs KMnO 4 titration, the initial formation of MnSO 4 takes place at high temperature, which then acts as catalyst for further reaction. In the case of FAS vs KMnO 4, heating oxidizes Fe2+ into Fe3– by oxygen of air and error may be introduced in the experiment. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.(2): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(3): Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.(4): Both Statement I and Statement II are false

solution: For the titration : Oxalic acid v/s KMnO 4  2   4 2 2MnO  5(COO)  16H  2  2 2 10CO  2Mn  8H O This  reaction  is  slow  at  room  temperature,  but becomes fast at 60°C. Manganese(II) ions catalyse the  reaction;  thus,  the  reaction  is  autocatalytic; once manganese(II) ions are formed, it becomes faster and faster.

question_text: 53. Match the List-I with List-II List-I  List-II (Redox Reaction)  (Type of Redox Reaction) A  CH 4(g)  +  2O 2(g)  (I)  Disproportionatio CO  +  n reaction 2(g) 2H 2O (l) B  (II)  Combination 2NaH    (s) 2Na (s) + H reaction 2(g) C  V 2O 5(s) + 5Ca (s)  (III)  Decomposition  reaction 2V + (s) 5CaO (s) D  2H 2O 2(aq)  (IV)  Displacement  reaction 2H 2O (l) +O 2(g) Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: (A) Combustion of hydrocarbon (B)Decomposition into gaseous product. (C)Displacement of „V‟ by  „Ca‟ atom. (D) Disproportionation of H 2O 2–1 into O–2 and O° oxidation states.

question_text: 54. Given below are two statements : Statement  I  :  will  undergo Et Et N  Cl alkaline  hydrolysis  at  a  faster  rate  than Et Et CH  Cl Statement  II  :  N  Cl,  intramolecular Et Et substitution takes place first by involving lone pair of electrons on nitrogen. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below : correct incorrect

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
options.(2): Statement  I  is  incorrect  but  statement  II  is
options.(3): Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
options.(4): Statement  I  is  correct  but  Statement  II  is

solution: Et  Et N Et Et  a) –Cl and  CH 2  –  CH 2 CH  –Cl Et  b)   N+ Alkaline Hydrolysis Et OH– N–CH 2–CH 2–OH Et Et Rate of (a) is faster than rate of (b) because it is a intramolecular substitution.

question_text: 62. Both  acetaldehyde  and  acetone  (individually) undergo which of the following reactions? A.Iodoform Reaction B.Cannizaro Reaction C.Aldol condensation D.Tollen's Test E.Clemmensen Reduction Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: S.No. Name of  Acetaldehyde  Acetone Reaction CH 3–C–H  CH 3–C–CH 3 O  O 1  Iodoform reaction ve ve 2  Cannizaro  ve  ve 3  Aldol reaction ve ve 4  Tollen‟s test  ve ve 5  Clemmensen  ve ve reduction

question_text: 63. In a multielectron atom, which of the following orbitals described by three quantum numbers with have  same  energy  in  absence  of  electric  and magnetic fields? A.n = 1, 1 = 0, m 1 = 0 B.n = 2, 1 = 0, m 1 = 0 C.n = 2, 1 = 1, m 1 = 1 D.n = 3, 1 = 2, m 1 = 1 E.n = 3, 1 = 2, m 1 = 0 Choose the correct answer  from the options given below :
solution: orbital A : n = 1,  = 0, m  = 0 1s B : n = 2,  = 0, m = 0 2s C : n = 3,  = 1, m = 1 3p D : n = 3,  = 2, m = 1 3d E : n = 3,  = 2, m = 0 3d In  absence  of  electric  and  magnetic  fields,  all orbitals of 3d are degenerate

solution: CH 3–CH 2–CH 2–NO CH 2 3–CH 2–CH 2–Br 2 Ag  NO (A)  AgCN CH 3–CH 2–CH 2–NC (B)

question_text: 66. Consider the following elements In, Tl, Al, Pb, Sn and Ge. The most stable oxidation states of elements with highest  and  lowest  first  ionisation  enthalpies, respectively, are
solution: Among Al, In, Tl, Ge, Sn, Pb, the metal having highest IE 1 is Ge and lowest IE 1 is In. Most stable oxidation state of Ge is +4 and In is +3.

question_text: 67. The correct order of stability of following carbocations is : Ph–C    Ph–C    H 3C–CH 2–CH Ph  Ph Ph  H  CH 3   A  B  C  D
solution: A) Ph–C    B) Ph–C   Ph  Ph Ph  H  H 3C–CH 2–CH–CH 3  C)  D) Solution :- C is aromatic due to ve charge hence it is most stable A have more resonance structure B have less resonance structure D have only hyper conjugation Consider First Aromaticity > Resonance > Hyper conjugation Ans. D < B < A < C

question_text: 68. The compounds that produce CO 2 with aqueous NaHCO 3 solution are : A. CO 2H B. OH C. OH NO 2 NO 2 NO 2 D. CO 2H E. OH H 3CO Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: A, C, D produce CO 2 with aqueous NaHCO 3 solution. A,  C,  D  acids  are  stronger  acid  than  H 2CO 3 (Carbonic acid)

question_text: 69. Which  of  the  following  oxidation  reactions  are carried out by both K 2Cr 2O 7 and KMnO 4 in acidic medium ? A. I–  I 2 B. S2–  S  C. Fe2+  Fe3+ D.   IO I– 3– E. S 2O 32–  SO 42–  Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

70. Given below are two statements : Statement I : D-glucose pentaacetate reacts with 2, 4-dinitrophenylhydrazine. Statement  II  :  Starch,  on  heating  with concentrated  sulfuric  acid  at  100°C  and  2-3 atmosphere pressure produces glucose. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(2): Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.(3): Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.(4): Both Statement I and Statement II are true

solution: SECTION-B

73. The  molarity  of  a  70%  (mass/mass)  aqueous solution  of  a  monobasic  acid  (X)  is  _______ M(Nearest integer) [Given  : Density of aqueous  solution of (X) is
1.25 g mL–1 Molar mass of the acid is 70 g mol–1]
solution: Assuming 100 gm solution contain  70 gm solute. Volume of 100 gm solution will be 100 ml .

question_text: 75. The formation enthalpies,  for H and O f  H Θ (g) (g) are  220.0  and  250.0  kJ  respectively,  at mol–1,
